Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: இல்லாள்கண் தாழ்ந்த இயல்பின்மை எஞ்ஞான்றும் நல்லாருள் நாணுத் தரும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The frailty that stoops to a wife will always make (her husband) feel ashamed among the good.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A man is shown bowing down and submitting ('தாழ்ந்த') to his wife in an unseemly, servile manner. This is his unworthy nature ('இயல்பின்மை').
Layered_Composition.Midground: This scene is taking place in the presence of a group of good, dignified, and respectable people ('நல்லார்').
Layered_Composition.Background: The man's subservient behavior causes him to feel a deep and constant sense of shame ('நாணுத் தரும்') before this assembly of the good. His own actions make it impossible for him to stand tall among them.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The unmanly nature of being subservient to one's wife will always be a source of shame when in the company of good people.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The act of bowing servilely to the wife, contrasted with the upright, dignified posture of the good people watching, is the key visual. The man's face is etched with shame.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A clear, judgmental light from the 'good people' illuminates the shameful act. The man is cast in a shadow of his own making.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot from the perspective of the 'good people', looking at the shameful display.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with a focus on the body language of submission and dignity.

Cultural_Anchors: Causing shame among the good ('நல்லாருள் நாணுத் தரும்')
